key_insight: eMOSAIC combines multimodal molecular and protein information with per-sample out‑of‑distribution (OOD) uncertainty estimation to substantially improve binding affinity prediction for compounds that act on multiple targets.
problem_solved: Addresses unreliable binding affinity predictions in polypharmacology caused by distributional shifts and lack of calibrated, sample‑level uncertainty, which hinder safe prioritization of multi‑target compounds.
method: Multimodal fusion of chemical, protein sequence/structure and interaction features to produce richer representations for each compound–target pair.
Per‑sample OOD detection and individual uncertainty quantification that flags low‑confidence predictions and calibrates model outputs.
OOD‑aware training/evaluation pipeline that integrates uncertainty signals to improve accuracy and decision thresholds for polypharmacology scenarios.
impact: Enables AI/ML practitioners to produce more reliable, risk‑aware affinity predictions and better prioritize multi‑target drug candidates; reduces false confidence on out‑of‑distribution cases and supports safer downstream experimental investment.
visual_elements: Schematic diagram of the multimodal model: inputs (compound, protein sequence, structure) → fusion module → affinity + per‑sample uncertainty outputs
Calibration/uncertainty map: scatter or reliability plot showing improved calibration and OOD detection versus baseline
Performance bar chart: accuracy/AUROC or error reduction for in‑distribution vs OOD test sets, highlighting gains for polypharmacology cases
Case network graphic: a small molecule connected to multiple protein nodes with confidence badges (high/low) to show actionable predictions
paper_title: Multimodal out-of-distribution individual uncertainty quantification enhances binding affinity prediction for polypharmacology
paper_authors: Amitesh Badkul, Li Xie, Shuo Zhang, Lei Xie
